content:
Returns None if the frame size of the given DataFrame object is None 

I'm confused, doesn't it (the inner function) always return None even if time isn't None? Or do they mean the outer function (shift_maker) should return None?
subject: shift_maker return None?

content: Sorry the directions are a bit confusing here. The intention is that the inner function that you define does nothing if the DataFrame passed to it has a frame size None. It will always return None, but in the case that its frame size is None, the inner function should simply return None without doing anything else.
